In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the definition of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(str::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(str)
    wrapped_lines = String[]
    
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(wrapped_lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end
    
    if !isempty(line)
        push!(wrapped_lines, line)
    end

    return join(wrapped_lines, "\n")
end
```

Now let's provide an example usage of the `wrap_string` function:

```julia
text = "This is a sample text with words that might exceed a maximum text width of 10 characters."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```

When you run this code, it will print out the wrapped text, respecting the `text_width` limit.
